main event: A large, green ball-shaped object appeared to explode and disappear downward in the sky near Russell, Kansas on January 27, 1961.
interesting points: The object was observed visually from the ground for about 15 seconds.
The witness reported hearing a loud explosion at the same time as the object's disappearance.
The rapid rate of ascent and disappearance of the object suggested it may have been a meteorite or bolide entering the Earth's atmosphere.
The document mentions that some factors called bolides, when seen, are often mistaken for man-made objects.
The report includes details about the weather conditions and the location of the sighting, which was approximately 10 miles southwest of Russell, Kansas.
